frame.name: Being_attached
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Item</fen> is attached by a <fen>Handle</fen>, via a <fen>Connector</fen>, to a <fen>Goal</fen>, or <fen>Items</fen> are attached to each other. There may be a <fen>Dependent_state</fen>, which depends crucially on <fen>Item</fen>(s) being attached.
<ex><fex name="Item">My thumb</fex> <m>was</m> <t>stuck</t> <fex name="Goal">to the tube of glue</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Items">The prisoner's legs</fex> were <t>shackled</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Connector
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Connector</fen> identifies the instrument used to attach and is usually expressed in a <ment>with</ment>-PP.
<ex>The tarp is <t>tied</t> down <fex name="Conn">with a rope</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Handle
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Handle</fen> identifies the point of attachment on the <fen>Item</fen>.
<ex>Harry was <t>tied</t> <fex name="Handle">by the neck</fex> to the tree.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Item
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Item</fen> identifies the entity that comes to be attached to the <fen>Goal</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Item">A handle</fex> was <t>affixed</t> to the door.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Items
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Items</fen> identifies the plural items that are tied together, resulting in their mutual attachment.
<ex><fex name="Items">The boats</fex> remained <t>tied</t> together.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Goal
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Goal</fen> identifies the location to which the <fen>Item</fen>(s) is attached.
<ex>The boat remained <t>anchored</t> <fex name="Goal">to the coastline</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Dependent_state
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Dependent_state</fen> identifies the state of the <fen>Item</fen> or <fen>Items</fen> which depends on the existence of the attachment. <ex>The tarp is <t>tied</t> <fex name="State">down</fex> with a cord.</ex> <ex>Harry's hands are <t>tied</t> <fex name="State">down</fex>with cords.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Manner</fen> in which an <fen>Item</fen> is in an attached state to a <fen>Goal</fen>, or two <fen>Items</fen> are attached to each other.
<ex>The tiny stick was <t>fastened</t> <fex name="Manner">tightly</fex> to his wrist.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: attached.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being fastened or joined

lexUnit.name: tied.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being fastened to something else with a rope-like instrument

lexUnit.name: bolted.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being fastened to something else with a bolt

lexUnit.name: glued.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being attached to something else with glue

lexUnit.name: affixed.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being directly attached to something else

lexUnit.name: anchored.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being secured firmly in position

lexUnit.name: bound.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being fastened to something else

lexUnit.name: chained.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: The state of being attached to something else with a chain

lexUnit.name: fastened.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being attached to something else

lexUnit.name: fused.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being attached to something else in that the two items have been joined to form one

lexUnit.name: handcuffed.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of bieng attached to something else with handcuffs

lexUnit.name: lashed.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being fastened to something else with a cord or rope

lexUnit.name: manacled.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being attached to something else with manacles

lexUnit.name: moored.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of a boat being attached to a shore or anchor with a rope or cable

lexUnit.name: nailed.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being fastened to something else with nails

lexUnit.name: pasted.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being fastened to something else with paste

lexUnit.name: pinned.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being attached to something else with a pin or pins

lexUnit.name: riveted.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being fastened to something else with a rivet or rivets

lexUnit.name: sewn.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being attached to something else with stiches made with a needle and thread

lexUnit.name: shackled.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being attached to something else with shackles

lexUnit.name: stapled.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being fastened to something else with staples

lexUnit.name: stuck.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: being caused to adhere

lexUnit.name: tethered.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being fastened to something else with a tether

lexUnit.name: welded.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of a metal part being attached to another metal part with the use of heat to melt the metal

lexUnit.name: stick.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: adhere or cause to adhere.

lexUnit.name: taped.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being attached to something else with tape

lexUnit.name: plastered.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: firmly attached

lexUnit.name: adhere.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to be sticking to something

lexUnit.name: adhesion.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of adhering.

lexUnit.name: connected.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: linked together.

lexUnit.name: linked.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: connected as by a link.
